text:
The current documentation and examples (in particular the Haxby example) are misleading, because they start from raw data. We need to stress that the typical situation is to start from beta maps, and that those beta maps need to be estimated by another software.

Also, we need to have other datasets that are made of beta maps to make the examples more realistic.
title: Documentation should point out that inputs are beta

text: Agreed. Do you have any dataset in mind?

> Agreed. Do you have any dataset in mind?

I am thinking that we could host online the beta maps from the Jimura &
Poldrack data (I need to ask Poldrack's permission, but I expect that it
won't be a problem). We also need a good classification setting, as this
is really the most common situation. For this one, I am still looking.
Maybe beta maps computed from https://openfmri.org/dataset/ds000107 . We
need to ask @schwarty about that last one. He would know.
